name: The Iliad
author: Homer
author's bio: Homer is a legendary ancient Greek epic poet, traditionally said to be the author of the epic poems The Iliad and The Odyssey.
synopsis: The Iliad is an epic poem set during the Trojan War, which tells the story of the wrath of Achilles, one of the most famous warriors in Greek mythology.

name: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
author's bio: Dante Alighieri was an Italian poet, writer, and philosopher. He is best known for his epic poem The Divine Comedy.
synopsis: The Divine Comedy is an epic poem that tells the story of Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven. Along the way, he meets various characters and learns valuable lessons about life, death, and morality.

name: Sherlock Holmes
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
author's bio: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was a British writer and physician, best known for creating the character of Sherlock Holmes.
synopsis: Sherlock Holmes is a collection of 56 short stories and four novels featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his assistant Dr. John Watson. Together, they solve various mysteries and crimes in Victorian England.

title: Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking
author: Susan Cain
author's bio: Susan Cain is an American writer, lecturer, and author of Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking.
synopsis: Quiet is a nonfiction book that explores the power of introverts in a world that often favors extroverts. Cain argues that introverts have unique strengths and abilities that are often overlooked or undervalued.

title: Alice in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
author's bio: Lewis Carroll was the pen name of English writer Charles Lutwidge Dodgson, best known for his children's books, including Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.
synopsis: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland is a novel about a young girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole and enters a fantasy world filled with strange and wondrous creatures.

title: The Bible
author: Various
author's bio: The Bible is a collection of religious texts that were written over many centuries by various authors.
synopsis: The Bible is the primary religious text of Christianity, containing the Old and New Testaments. It tells the story of the creation of the world, the history of the Jewish people, the life and teachings of Jesus Christ, and the early history of the Christian church.

author: George Orwell
author's bio: George Orwell was an English writer and journalist, best known for his novels Animal Farm and Nineteen Eighty-Four.
synopsis: 1984 is a dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where individualism and independent thinking are outlawed. The story follows the life of Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of the ruling party, who begins to rebel against the system.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
author's bio: Jared Diamond is an American scientist and author, best known for his books on human evolution and environmental history.
synopsis: Guns, Germs, and Steel is a nonfiction book that explores why certain societies developed more rapidly than others. Diamond argues that environmental factors, such as geography and climate, played a significant role in shaping the course of human history.

title: Les Fleurs du Mal
author: Charles Baudelaire
author's bio: Charles Baudelaire was a French poet and critic, best known for his collection of poems, Les Fleurs du Mal.
synopsis: Les Fleurs du Mal is a collection of poems that explores themes of beauty, sensuality, and decay. It was highly controversial when it was first published in 1857, and Baudelaire was prosecuted for obscenity.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
author's bio: Victor Hugo was a French poet, novelist, and dramatist, best known for his novels Les Misérables and Notre-Dame de Paris.
synopsis: Les Misérables follows the lives of several characters in 19th-century France, including ex-convict Jean Valjean, his pursuer Inspector Javert, and the young girl Cosette, who Valjean adopts as his own daughter.

title: The Three Musketeers
author: Alexandre Dumas
author's bio: Alexandre Dumas was a French writer and playwright, best known for his novels The Three Musketeers and The Count of Monte Cristo.
synopsis: The Three Musketeers follows the adventures of three musketeers, Athos, Porthos, and Aramis, and their young, brave companion, D'Artagnan, as they fight to protect the honor of their queen and their country.
